{{also|finne}} ==German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈfɪnə/}} * {{audio|de|De-at-Finne.ogg|Audio (Austria)}} ===Etymology 1=== ====Noun==== {{de-noun|m|Finnen|Finnen}} # [[Finn]] {{gloss|person from Finland}} =====Declension===== {{de-decl-noun-m|n|n}} =====Synonyms===== * {{l|de|Finnländer}} {{qual|archaic, nowadays nonstandard}} =====Derived terms===== * {{l|de|Finnin}} * {{l|de|finnisch}} =====Related terms===== * {{l|de|Finnland}} ===Etymology 2=== From {{etyl|gml|de}} {{m|gml|finne}}, {{m|gml|vinne}}, from {{etyl|osx|de}} {{m|osx|*finna}}, from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*finnō}}. More at {{l|en|fin}}. [[File:Hammer Schlosserhammer mit Rohrstiel.jpg|thumb|right|Als '''Finne''' bezeichnet man den keilförmig zulaufenden Teil eines Hammerkopfs.]] ====Noun==== {{de-noun|f||Finnen}} # big [[dorsal fin]] as found in large fish and marine mammals # the wedge-shaped end of a [[hammer]]'s [[head]] =====Declension===== {{de-decl-noun-f|n}} =====Derived terms===== * {{l|de|Finnwal}} [[Category:de:Finland]]
